business.headline: Sensex, Nifty recover losses to end marginally higher amid volatilityThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 57.65 points to close at 75,996.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 30.25 points to end at 22,959.50.

Regulatory body warns against rising NPS scams, issues these guidelines The Pension Fund Regulatory and Development Authority (PFRDA) has cautioned subscribers of the National Pension Scheme (NPS) and Atal Pension Yojayna (APY) regarding fraudulent calls demanding money to release pension funds.

Government may set up reserve fund for stable EPFO interest rates: ReportThe labour and employment ministry is conducting an internal study to explore the creation of an interest stabilisation reserve fund under the EPFO, sources said familiar with the matter.

PM SVANidhi scheme: Know about eligibility and Rs 30,000 credit cardsPM SVANidhi scheme eligibility: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman in her Budget 2025 speech announced providing credit cards under the PM SVANidhi scheme.

Is your money safe in co-operative banks safe? RBI's latest curbs raise concernConcerns over New India Co-operative Bank's financial stability and a potential Rs 122 crore scam prompted the RBI to take strict action. This incident has added to the growing list of cooperative banks facing regulatory action.

India Inc sees worst quarter in 5 years: What it means for stock market? The recently concluded Q3 earnings season has been the weakest for India Inc since the first quarter of FY21, according to a report by domestic brokerage firm Motilal Oswal.

Radhika Gupta on market volatility: Bad times don't last. Good investors doRadhika Gupta's advice comes as stock markets continue to witness a downward trend, with the sell-off in smallcap and midcap stocks intensifying.

Senco Gold share price tumbles 32% in 2 sessions. Here's what brokerages saySenco Gold stock price: The sell-off started on February 14 after the company reported its quarterly numbers showing profits plunged 69.3% to Rs 33.48 crore compared to Rs 109.32 crore a year ago.

Markets down, volatility up: 3 factors making Dalal Street investors nervousThe NSE Nifty50 has stumbled, dropping 3.2% in just eight trading sessions and slipping below the psychologically important 23,000 mark. The Sensex tells a similar tale of woe, falling over 3% to fall below 76,000.

TCS to issue hike letters soon; salary raise likely between 4-8%: ReportThe annual salary hikes at leading IT firms have gradually reduced over the years. In FY24, TCS employees received an average hike of 7-9%, while in FY22, the hikes were around 10.5%.

Should you avoid smallcap, midcap stocks amid ongoing market correction?One of the primary reasons behind this downturn is the steep valuations of smallcap and midcap stocks, which analysts believe had reached unsustainable levels.

Sensex tanks over 600 points: 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayStock market today: At 9:58 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 577.20 points, trading at 75,362.01, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 176.30 points, standing at 22,752.95.

entertainment.headline: The Witch review: Jinyoung, Jeong-eui shine in slow-burning psychological mysteryReleased-Sat Feb 15, 2025The Witch review: The Witch, a new K-drama starring Jinyoung and Jeong-eui, captivates with its psychological mystery and slow-burning narrative. The series, based on a popular webtoon, blends mystery, romance, and suspense, leaving viewers intrigued by the enigmatic characters and their complex interactions, says our review.

Rashami Desai on love-hate bond with Sidharth Shukla: We'd communicate through eyesActor Rashami Desai, who had worked with the late Sidharth Shukla on 'Dil Se Dil Tak' and 'Bigg Boss 13', was reminded of her relationship with him on comedian Bharti Singh's podcast.

Stray Kids' Felix suffers fracture after car accident, misses group's fan meetFelix, a member of the boy band Stray Kids, suffered an arm fracture in a minor car accident, causing him to miss the band's fifth fan meeting.

South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron wanted to make a comeback to films, open a cafeSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, who was found dead in her apartment on Sunday, had wished to make a comeback to the entertainment world, revealed a friend recently.

Gajraj Rao, Renuka Shahane's Dupahiya to bring laughter and chaos to Prime VideoPrime Video's Dupahiya is set in a crime-free village where the first-ever theft of a motorbike creates chaos and drama. Starring Gajraj Rao and Renuka Shahane, the comedy series starts streaming on March 7.

South Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, 24, found deadSouth Korean actor Kim Sae-ron, known for her roles in Bloodhounds and The Man from Nowhere, was found dead at her home in Seoul. She was 24. Authorities are investigating the circumstances of her death, with no signs of foul play reported yet.

The White Lotus S3 review: Predictable? Yes. Addictive? Also, yesReleased-Mon Feb 17, 2025The White Lotus Season 3 review: The White Lotus returns with a new season set in Thailand, offering a fresh cultural backdrop while retaining its biting satire on the ultra-rich. The series continues to entertain with its dark humour and ensemble cast, though its formula is starting to feel familiar. Read our full review.

Kanye West says he fought 5 hours for Grammy tickets amid guest list confusionRapper Kanye West, in a post on X, revealed that he fought for five hours to secure Grammy tickets amid guest list chaos. This comes amid claims that Kanye arrived at the event uninvited.

Comedian Anubhav Bassi's Lucknow show cancelled after warning over foul languageThe shows of comedian Anubhav Singh Bassi in Lucknow were cancelled due to concerns over inappropriate content, following a complaint by the UP Women's Commission vice-chairperson. Authorities cited potential law and order issues as reasons for the cancellation.

Watch: Chum Darang blushes as Karan Veer confesses love on Valentine's DayKaran Veer Mehra confessed his love for Chum Darang on Valentine's Day. Chum shared a post from their romantic outing on social media.
Watch: Ed Sheeran pauses Delhi concert as fan faints, wears Team India jerseyEd Sheeran wrapped up his India tour in Gurugram on February 15. He paused his concert briefly to help a fan who fainted.

Shalin Bhanot reacts to India's Got Latent Row, advocates self-disciplineTV actor Shalin Bhanot has reacted to the controversy surrounding YouTuber Ranveer Allahbadia's comment on India's Got Latent during the FDCI's India Men's Weekend in Jaipur. He emphasised self-discipline and responsibility.

general news.headline: Congress distances from Sam Pitroda's China remark: Definitely not party's viewThe Congress distanced itself from Sam Pitroda's remarks on China, stating they do not reflect the party's views. Pitroda questioned the perceived Chinese threat, calling it exaggerated. Congress reaffirmed concerns over China's security and economic challenges.

Disease is not a joke, what's a stand-up comic got to do with it?Diseases are to be discussed at a symposium sponsored by big pharmaceutical companies where doctors fly in on tickets paid for by the big pharmaceutical companies. Is that Kashmiri comic a doctor, a pharmacist, or a journalist?

Turban thrown in dustbin, tortured in US detention camp: Deportee recounts horrorA 23-year-old man who was deported from the US to Amritsar along with 111 others on Sunday alleged he faced torture in a detention camp when he was caught entering the US illegally. He claimed he was in shackles on the deportation flight.

Rahul Gandhi slammed for flying banned Chinese drone: 'Rules don't apply to him?' In a video posted on X, Congress MP Rahul Gandhi showcased a Chinese DJI drone which has been banned in India since 2022. He also acknowledged that "unfortunately, they don't allow to fly these in Lutyens Delhi".

Why Elon Musk takes 4-year-old son to every meeting.  Xtension or X-factor?Be it a meeting with PM Modi or a visit to the Oval Office, Elon Musk's son X seems to be part of his retinue. Why does Musk take the 4-year-old to meetings? This might have to do with Musk's lonely childhood, his strategy to carve a more acceptable image or the projection of an extension.

Polar vortex likely to bring 'life-threatening cold' to US after flooding kills 10A polar vortex is bringing life-threatening cold to the Rockies and northern Plains after winter storms battered the eastern US, killing at least 10 people. Kentucky saw severe flooding, with nine deaths, while snow and ice caused road chaos in the Midwest.

Delhi quake: Government warns of possible aftershocks, PM's 'stay calm' appealPrime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday urged the residents of Delhi-NCR region to stay calm and follow safety protocols in case of possible aftershocks following a 4.0 magnitude earthquake in the national capital.

There is a limit to petitions: Top court defers pleas on Places of Worship Act Earlier, the Supreme Court expressed its displeasure over the filing of several fresh pleas in a case related to the validity of the Places of Worship Act, which mandates the religious character of a place to be maintained as it existed on August 15, 1947.

Akshaye Khanna's Aurangzeb act in Chhaava: Internet says actor is back and howChhaava: The internet cannot get enough of Akshaye Khanna's performance as Mughal emperor Aurangzeb. Apart from Akshaye, the film also stars Vicky Kaushal and Rashmika Mandanna in pivotal roles.

What EVM data Supreme Court doesn't want Election Commission to eraseThe court directed the poll panel not to erase or reload EVM data for scrutiny, questioning its SOPs and Rs 40,000 fee. The panel must clarify before the March hearing

Zomato launches Nugget, the no-code, AI-powered customer support platformIn a post on X, Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal announced that his company has launched Nugget, an AI-powered customer support platform.

Indian flag missing from Karachi stadium before Champions Trophy, video goes viralIn a video that has gone viral on social media, the Indian flag was reportedly missing at the National stadium in Karachi ahead of the Champions Trophy 2025. At ICC events, it is common practice to have flags of all the participating nations displayed at each venue.

Milind Deora's special message for Maharashtra student who went paragliding to collegeIn a post on X, Shiv Sena MP Milind Deora shared a heartfelt message for the Maharashtra student whose paragliding video, showing him flying to the college to avoid traffic, went viral last week.

New crowd control plan after Delhi stampede: Focus on 60 stations, use of AIDays after a stampede killed 18 people at the New Delhi railway station, the Centre has introduced a new crowd control plan, including the creation of permanent holding zones at 60 high-traffic stations, sources told India Today TV.

Bad dream to new dawn: Pakistan ready to welcome major ICC event after 3 decadesChampions Trophy 2025: Pakistan is set to host a major cricket tournament after nearly three decades, marking a significant comeback for international cricket in the country. Despite India opting to play in Dubai, excitement is high, with Pakistan hoping to host a successful tournament.

Where will Delhi's new Chief Minister take oath? Possible venuesDelhi's new chief minister oath-taking ceremony will most likely take place on February 20, with Ramlila Maidan, Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium, and the Yamuna riverfront as potential venues.

Prateik's wife on Raj Babbar's absence from wedding: All who mattered were thereActor Prateik Babbar married Priya Banerjee in an intimate ceremony but didn't invite father Raj Babbar. Priya said everyone who mattered to them and who they consider as family were a part of the celebration.

US site drops Taiwan independence reference, China urges it to 'correct mistakes'China urged the US to "correct its mistakes" after the State Department removed wording opposing Taiwan independence. Beijing called it a provocative move, while Taiwan welcomed US support.

No money, Pandya brothers said they had Maggi for 3 years: Nita Ambani on MI findIPL 2025: Mumbai Indians owner Nita Ambani revealed how the franchise were able to land the Pandya brothers and Jasprit Bumrah and make them a vital part of the Indian cricket team. Bumrah and the Pandya brothers won multiple titles with MI.

After Revanth Reddy's caste jibe at Modi, BJP questions Rahul Gandhi's lineageBJP and Congress are locked in a caste-politics battle in Telangana after Chief Minister Revanth Reddy claimed Prime Minister Modi was a 'legally converted Backward Class.' BJP leader Bandi Sanjay hit back, questioning Rahul Gandhi's caste, alleging Rajiv Gandhi was a Parsi.

India Art Fair: Is social media turning art into a mainstream sensation? India Art Fair's latest edition was sold out. Was it just social media outreach playing its part, or were genuine art connoisseurs, in larger numbers, filling the void?

Trinamool's 'half minister, side gig' jibe at Ashwini Vaishnaw on Delhi stampedeDelhi Stampede: Union Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has come under fire after the stampede at New Delhi Railway station claimed 18 lives on Friday. The TMC repeated the 'half minister' jibe to slam the minister for holding two key ministries.

Appear in person tomorrow, not via video, cyber cell tells comic Samay RainaIndia's Got Latent Controversy: The Maharashtra Cyber Cell has directed YouTuber Samay Raina to appear in person on February 18 to record his statement regarding the obscene remarks row on the now-deleted show India's Got Latent.

One-year BEd, MEd courses to return in 2026, 2-year and 4-year options to continueThe NCTE will bring back the one-year BEd and MEd programmes in 2026, while continuing the two-year versions. The four-year Integrated Teacher Education Programme (ITEP) will expand as well, offering new specialised teacher training options. Here are the different teacher training pathways explained.

Silent and sinister: How Akshaye Khanna's Aurangzeb stole ChhaavaAkshaye Khanna delivers a chilling, restrained portrayal of Mughal emperor Aurangzeb in Chhaava, standing out amid past cinematic depictions. His silent menace contrasts Vicky Kaushal's fiery energy, proving that true power doesn't always need words—just presence.

Composer Thaman performs at NTR Trust event for free, Balayya gifts him PorscheComposer Thaman performed at NTR Trust's musical night without any remuneration. The event was conducted to support Thalassemia patients.

Pics: Vijay Deverakonda's holy trip to Maha Kumbh 2025, Kashi Vishwanath templeVijay Deverakonda, along with his mother, visited the Maha Kumbh 2025. The actor shared a post with glimpses from the holy trip,

Kate Winslet to make directorial debut with family drama Goodbye JuneAcademy Award-winning actor Kate Winslet will soon be making her directorial debut with the family drama, Goodbye June. It will be produced by Netflix.

sports.headline: Hope Pakistan team would do justice to PCB's renovation work: Mohammad YousufFormer Pakistan cricketer Mohammad Yousuf hopes that the Pakistan cricket team will do justice to the work done by their national board to host Champions Trophy with their performances on the field.

Bad dream to new dawn: Pakistan ready to welcome major ICC event after 3 decadesChampions Trophy 2025: Pakistan is set to host a major cricket tournament after nearly three decades, marking a significant comeback for international cricket in the country. Despite India opting to play in Dubai, excitement is high, with Pakistan hoping to host a successful tournament.

After missing WPL, star RCB all-rounder skips Sri Lanka series WPL 2025: Sophie Devine has pulled out of New Zealand's limited-overs series against Sri Lanka. Devine, earlier, opted out of the Women's Premier League (WPL) where she represents Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB).

Indian flag missing from Karachi stadium before Champions Trophy, video goes viralIn a video that has gone viral on social media, the Indian flag was reportedly missing at the National stadium in Karachi ahead of the Champions Trophy 2025. At ICC events, it is common practice to have flags of all the participating nations displayed at each venue.

Jasprit Bumrah's absence gives Bangladesh a chance vs India: Imrul KayesChampions Trophy: Imrul Kayes said that Jasprit Bumrah's absence will give Bangladesh a decent chance in their match against India on February 20 at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.

Mohammed Shami can carry India's attack in Bumrah's absence: Laxmipathy BalajiChampions Trophy 2025: Former pacer Laxmipathy Balaji feels that Mohammed Shami could be the leader of the Indian bowling attack during Jasprit Bumrah's absence at the Champions Trophy. Shami made his return to international cricket during the England T20I series.

No money, Pandya brothers said they had Maggi for 3 years: Nita Ambani on MI findIPL 2025: Mumbai Indians owner Nita Ambani revealed how the franchise were able to land the Pandya brothers and Jasprit Bumrah and make them a vital part of the Indian cricket team. Bumrah and the Pandya brothers won multiple titles with MI.

Virat Kohli eyes Universe Boss Chris Gayle's historic record Champions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli has the chance of becoming the leading run-scorer in the tournament, going past the legendary Chris Gayle, who scored 791 runs from 17 matches.

My PR is my cricket: Ajinkya Rahane targets return to Indian Test teamRanji Trophy 2024-25: Ajinkya Rahane is aiming for a comeback into the Indian Test team as he feels there is cricket left in him. Rahane last played for India in Tests during the West Indies tour in 2023.

Not dissimilar to Jasprit Bumrah: Ex-captain defends Aussie spinner's bowling actionFormer Australia captain Tim Paine jumped to the defence of Matt Kuhnemann, claiming that the spinner has a similar action to that of Jasprit Bumrah. Kuhnemann was reported for suspect action after the Sri Lanka Test series.

When Shakib Al Hasan, Mahmudullah's heroics shocked New ZealandChampions Trophy: Back in 2017, Bangladesh recorded a famous win against New Zealand after Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah's heroic 224-run partnership at the Sophia Gardens in Cardiff. Shakib and Mahmudullah's twin centuries helped the Tigers chase down 266 with 16 balls to spare.

No money, Pandya brothers said they had Maggi for 3 years: Nita Ambani on MI findIPL 2025: Mumbai Indians owner Nita Ambani revealed how the franchise were able to land the Pandya brothers and Jasprit Bumrah and make them a vital part of the Indian cricket team. Bumrah and the Pandya brothers won multiple titles with MI.

Virat Kohli eyes Universe Boss Chris Gayle's historic record Champions Trophy 2025: Virat Kohli has the chance of becoming the leading run-scorer in the tournament, going past the legendary Chris Gayle, who scored 791 runs from 17 matches.

My PR is my cricket: Ajinkya Rahane targets return to Indian Test teamRanji Trophy 2024-25: Ajinkya Rahane is aiming for a comeback into the Indian Test team as he feels there is cricket left in him. Rahane last played for India in Tests during the West Indies tour in 2023.

Not dissimilar to Jasprit Bumrah: Ex-captain defends Aussie spinner's bowling actionFormer Australia captain Tim Paine jumped to the defence of Matt Kuhnemann, claiming that the spinner has a similar action to that of Jasprit Bumrah. Kuhnemann was reported for suspect action after the Sri Lanka Test series.

When Shakib Al Hasan, Mahmudullah's heroics shocked New ZealandChampions Trophy: Back in 2017, Bangladesh recorded a famous win against New Zealand after Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah's heroic 224-run partnership at the Sophia Gardens in Cardiff. Shakib and Mahmudullah's twin centuries helped the Tigers chase down 266 with 16 balls to spare.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
